message:
I was about ask a question regarding this post but after reading
[Should I expose synchronous wrappers for asynchronous methods?](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/pfxteam/should-i-expose-synchronous-wrappers-for-asynchronous-methods/).
It shed some more light on the pit fall you are trying to guide your readers from providing the last pieces I needed to fully understand. Still I find *never* to be a bit strong; I'd rather say *use it wisely and sparingly, and keep in mind why it is dangerous in the first place*â€”but that just my opinion.

I still would like to see you providing an all async/await solution for every and all case you face.
